reviewText: I decided to try this game on a whim because of some of the reviews but upon further inspection i realize I may be late to this party. I rolled on the US East server, there were 3 choices, US East, US West, and Aus i think? Well here has been my experience playing to level 20.\n\nThe thing that got me playing at all was the character cuztomization, This is a decent system and i like the diferent looks and possibilities however. Each class is gender locked which to me seems sounter productive. So if I want to play as a sorceress i must choose evie" who is female. I can then alter her look however i wish. My question is why gender lock the roles? Now this doens't bother me as i like sorcerers and female avatars but i know some people would be put off by this. Such as if you wish to play the ranger class you must pick a male avatar. etc etc.  Pro: You can alter your character to look pretty much any way you desire
date:
Con: Gender locking classes

Redundancy.
In order to do quests you have to get them from npcs of course then you must locate the battle board to select a dungeon you wish to do.  Then you either join a part who is waiting in the staging area. A rarity i am sure
recommended: or create your own party and invite whoever you like. Then you board the boat and see the same dramatic heroic scene reminiscent of soul calibur and off you go
hoursPlayed: each area has dungeons that look exactly the same. You may go through 10 dungeons that all are nearly identical but rearranged to fight red name bosses and win the day. then back to town. Rinse and repeat. This has become.. redundant.\n\nPopulation
voteText:
Seems very low. The starting area "colhen" looks populated but that's as far as it goes. If you decide to venture out to the other few areas of the game where high level players should be doing their thing you'll find a ghost town. This is a shame because now i feel put off form bothering. It appears that everyone just hangs out on colhen. There isn;t a whol elot to ehis game.


Raids. Seems easy to be called raids. I did a raid on the first available raid dungeon with two friends. They died relatively fast but i managed ot finish the boss by myself. Wasn't too difficult even on hard mode. Rewards weren't great either. I imagine these do get harder as you progress if you do that is.

All in all i am not ready to quit the game as of yet so I will keep leveling and seeing what else the game has to offer. mainly because i have nothing better to do these days. Going to recommend the game so more people play it because it seems the only major thing lacking is population. Seems to be a big trend with mmos these days. Shame really. Will update this again another time."

reviewText:
Pros:
-variety of characters: each character plays very differently
-character customizability: character creation and in-game items
-combat system is very fluid
-graphics have held up nicely over the years
-boss battles actually feel like boss battles

Cons:
-repetitive enviroments for 1st season
-lots of grinding (levels 1-60 go by pretty fast; 60+ starts getting grindy)
-game can be pay-to-win(e.g. AP being sold in the cash shop)

overall the game can be pretty fun.

reviewText: My previous review was negative and it remains negative for anyone having the annoying BlackCipher" glitch while using Windows 10. For people like me
date: I had to revert my Windows back to 8.1 to play
recommended: and I know that this sounds insane just to play 1 game. The only reason I did this was I had very high hopes for this game. Was it worth it? Well you probably know the answer to that just by the rating of this review. This game has a lot to offer and I am barely so far scratching the surface for this game. This game feels like a game I would be willing to pay retail price for
hoursPlayed: but of course it is free. The number one question people always ask though is "Is it P2W?" My answer to this is no. The only thing I would recommend paying for is the .99 starter pack for it is one hell of a deal and makes low level leveling easier if you are by yourself. Other then that you can pay for cosmetics and let me just say the cosemetics range from really scimpy or cute to full blown f*cking awesome! So unless you want to pay for some of the costumes this game is fair and balanced in combat. Combat is awesome because I have never met a game where you can just grab a enemy and use the enviroment to kill him. These kills range from Sparta kicking some one of a cliff to body slamming them on a pile of rubble. Think of this game as a beat them up with very hard but rewarding boss fights. reviewText: Vindictus is a game that can be both enjoyable and challenging, but can also be tedious and long. The first couple of levels are a cake walk. You start out with the basic skills and equipment and as you further move along the game, you gain more points for skills, random weapon/equipment drops fit for your current level, and in-game money for future spending. This stage of the game is easy and can be finished, solo with little effort. However, as the levels get harder and the bosses get bigger (polar bears to trolls to wolves to dragons to demons), more effort is needed to continue further. Solo is pretty much gone unless you're a high enough level and have high tier equipment. But at this stage, team work and the in-game market come into play. You will need other people to play with to complete the oncoming barrage of difficult levels and the Market in-game is needed to get more powerful and resilient equipment (in-game money used). So if communication and grinding aren't your thing, Vindictus' mid-late and late game will not be for you. However, with enough hard work and dedication, you can be a hulking image in Vindictus with no real life money spent whatsoever. Vindictus trully is a game for the dedicated and skilled.\n\n-Yumi

reviewText:
While attractive and enjoyable as far as grinding MMOs go, the infamously awful servers this game uses earns it a well-earned thumbs down.

The worst of the problems caused is when players get cheated out of earned points. Four times now, I have completed a mission and had the server connection die before the game could award any points or rewards earned by playing those missions.

It is enormously frustrating for this to happen and makes playing the game pointless (both figuratively and literally, since you will score no points after playing it). There are minor lag issues - stutters and freezes and stuff like that. Players have been telling the game host about this apparently for years, with no changes.

Doesn't matter how pretty a game is if server lag makes it unplayable.

reviewText:
Edit: 6/4/2014

There's been alot of changes since my post in 2012. Most of what I stated before is still somewhat the same, but....

Nexon has once again practically ruined a game. Though Vindictus itself is still a load of fun and very skill oriented, Nexon has made some incredibly confusing and worrisome decisions. For one, they totally removed Jumping from the game. Now, Jumping in itself wasn't very well implemented. But instead of fixing it, they opted to delete it completely...which means all of the Season 2 maps that incorporated jumping mechanics, as well as Season 2 enemies that forced you to use Jumping to either kill them or dodge their attacks, have been totally reworked and, quite frankly, boring-ified. Now every enemy, though with different tactics and timing, all are dumbed down and simplified from before. Definitely a bad, bad change in my opinion.

Also, as for this game not being Pay2Win... It's slowly but surely becoming exactly that. You can buy cash accesories that give notable bonuses to stats, pets that do the same, and if you want to succeed in very high level play, you're definitely going to need to use a huge amount of ingame currency to strengthen your weapons, and then buy Runes to + them past +6. Infact, you're going to want +10 or higher weapons to be helpful in a group.

Anyway, that's my update. This game will forever hold a candle in my heart, but...*sigh* Nexon. Nexon strikes again. I still recommend it, but going higher than level 70 will be...very frustrating for most players.

There's a review by v0!dsnak3 that points out other problems perfectly, and ALL not due to the game itself, but because of Nexon being the way they are. Money grubbing event tactics, horrible events in general that focus more on cash players than free players...The list goes on. I suggest reading his/her review, as they nailed it on the head. (They gave Vin a thumbs down, which I have to say I agree with)

I'll keep my original review here as well. -------------------------------------------

reviewText: This could've been easily one of the best games. But nexon. Released on January 21, 2010, Vindictus was a promising game. Basically many players quit the game because vindictus slowly requred players to buy NX to enhance your items and get all your gear to +10 or farm for months just to get rare drops, and this slowly made vindictus a pay to win system. At high level raids you're going to get kicked from raids because you do not meet the quotas placed. Even then the actual level grind is just horrible. And when I say horrible, I mean horrible. You have to replay most of the time the same map over and over again with recycled Ai that use the same exact moves usually in the same exact spawns. reviewText:
Only played long enough to get to level 3, the game looks GREAT, it really does. But i was immediately put off by a couple of things.

Cons: Story Progression is done in a way most MMORPG players are not used to, as in the dialogue boxes and chat with npc's is very different from a traditional MMORPG. This is a detail that i think the veteran MMO players would find slightly frustrating, but maybe they would have the patience to let it grow on them. I however, found it very off putting.

Some weapons / classes are only available to certain genders. You pick a base character / hero at the very beginning, and you can tweak them later as far as physical appearance is concerned, and your name of course. But all of them use only one type of weapon, so if you want to use a glaive for instance, you are FORCED to play as a female character. Or if you want to use a great sword, you are FORCED to play a male character. Again, this may not matter for some, but to me  as a Veteran MMORPG player again this was off putting. I havn't even made it past character creation and my freedom is already being restricted? Not a good development choice.

Character creation is a bit lacking, there are some features that you can only use by acquiring items from the in game cash shop, and other features are just badly implimented (The sliders for fat/muscle imparticular feel bad / inaccurate)

Pros:
The game looks beautiful
Combat seems pretty fluid

reviewText:
NOT NEW PLAYER FRIENDLY!!! connection constantly drops in this mmo!!! I have a great expensive computer just for playing these kinds of games, but it doesn't really matter in vindictus. You can have a 3,000 dollar comp & still lag from other players no matter what. oh & CRASH a LOT!! for no reason!!!

I would say recommend if it was a newer game but the fact that these problems still exist in such an old mmo is just trouble. There are still such little things that could have been fixed 100000000 years ago, like the loot bouncing all over the screen & out of the map & into the ceilings.... that is just ridiculous!! the fact that you can't grab your loot after the report screen pops up so you miss everything...

They introduce you to the cash shops after like the 5th mission & they give you this default under armor that is - lets be honest- terrible looking with a lot of gear, so it makes you want to buy new under armor. it sucks!!! sure they let you pick a free hairstyle but only for 7 days. you even have to buy your face setup!! so unless you want to look like an asian teenager you have to spend some money on a new face/makeup.

I give this game like a 5/10 for now but it could use some work that won't be done. im guessing ever. Go play Warframe, it's a much better free to play.

reviewText: This thing is so poorly optimized its ridiculous. Its nothing like the video describes. The graphics look good but, it looks like they tried to build a game with a low budget, all purpose, graphics engine and it wasn't opitmized at all. The game play wasnt all that captivating either. The quest menu, character menus and NPC interfaces need to be dumbed down to match the simplicity of the actual game mechanics. In the end you get a quest, go to some bulleten board, load up a crappy instanced sailboat. Then you launch into a 10 minute map where you hack slash some generic monsters from an early 90s quake 2 type game and get some loot. All of which is pretty much designed to get you to buy stuff from the cash shop.\n\nThis does not, as the video says, crush" Warframe by any means."

reviewText: Nexon finally did something right. Vindictus is amazing in almost every sence of the word, featuring high intesnity battles and increasingly difficult yet fun boss raids, what's not to love? The first half of the game is very much a solo experience, as the battles and bosses are well balanced and simple to defeat. However, as you approach higher levels you are forced to work with others to take down the threats, allowing for an incredibly fun co-op experience. Character and class progression is good as the player chooses how to to level their skills, not the game. My only criticism is that co-op has no servers, save for major raid bosses. So if you want to co-op a normal battle quest you're relying on a p2p conection, which can be a huge problem for people playing with friends interstate.

reviewText:
This has got to be one of, if not the best MMO I have ever played. I love how Nexon added as much individualization to their character creation as they did. The only way they could really add to it would be making characters be either gender. I'm not sure where people are getting the Pay to Win style from because with the number of free cash shop items Nexon had given out, I got to level 60 without spending a dime. after that, I only bought cosmetic stuff(inner armor, tattoos, etc) until I hit about lever 65 at which point I bought 1 enhancement rune to try to get a weapon to +10(turned out I didn't need it, so I used it for another weapon).I think the community on this game(or at least 99% of it) is very pleasant. Sure you get trolls and irritating people, but find me any multiplayer game that doesn't have that. I thoroughly enjoy the raids offered, and the graphics definitely don't hurt that. That being said, the lag on here is slightly less than perfect, but that's forgiveable with the graphics and all the other stuff going on. Past the character and skills, the customization is nearly limitless. there are hundreds of armor sets and when combined, leave you with thousands, maybe millions, of combinations to give your character the look you want.If you're on the fence about trying this game, do yourself a favor and go for it. The beginning is a little slow, but that's the way all games are... you have to have time to learn the combat system and all the other stuff before you can take down a dragon with it, after all. On the note of combat system and controls, you can choose between keyboard, mouse, or gamepad(works with PS3/XBOX360 or later controllers) modes. Once you select the one you like most, you can fine-tune it to your ideal setup. My ratings for this game are...
Community: 4.75/5
Graphics:4-5/5(based on graphics settings, but even lowest are still quite wonderful)
Connection:3.75-5/5(depending on host and your individual settings along with device capabilities)
Story/Plot: 5/5
Character Customization/Skills: 4.75/5
Ease of use(to get started): 5/5(starts slow, but you learn all the in's and out's of the game)
Overall rating:4.5-4.9/5
